raw_text:
Wenger shock at Newcastle dip
 
 Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has admitted he is at a loss to explain why Newcastle are languishing in the bottom half of the table.
 
 The Gunners travel to St James' Park on Wednesday, with Newcastle 14th in the Premiership after a troubled season. And Wenger said: "At the beginning of the season you would expect them to be fighting for the top four. "I don't know how they got to be where they are. It looks to me from the outside that they have many injuries."
 
 Arsenal go into the game on the back of a 2-0 victory over Fulham on Sunday. And Wenger added: "The best way to prepare for a game is to win the previous one. We will go to Newcastle in good shape. "Fatigue won't play too big a part in the next few weeks as we have players coming back so I can rotate a bit more. "We do not play a season with 11 players and I believe that all of our squad deserve a chance in the team." Striker Thierry Henry, along with Robert Pires, scored against Fulham. And Henry afterwards described the display as "beautiful to watch". He said: "What matters is winning and the three points, of course. That is the only thing that really matters. But it is more enjoyable when you play like we did against Fulham. "We are playing as a team and that is important because there were some games when we maybe were not there as a team and suffered for that. Those were games we lost."
llama3.2:1b: Arsene Wenger expressed shock over Newcastle's poor performance, citing the team's injuries and fatigue as major factors. Wenger said they would prepare well for the game, despite having players returning from injury. He praised Thierry Henry's performance against Fulham, describing it as "beautiful to watch".
llama3.2:3b: Arsene Wenger expressed surprise at Newcastle's poor performance this season, saying injuries seem to be the main issue. He expects Arsenal to win at St James' Park due to their recent 2-0 victory over Fulham, which has helped him prepare a team with rotated players as some return from injury.
gemma2:2b: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is surprised by Newcastle's low league position this season and believes they should be fighting for the top four.  Despite a win against Fulham, Wenger plans to rotate his squad against Newcastle. Thierry Henry praised the team's performance in their previous game.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger admitted Newcastle's poor performance is beyond his expectations, noting they began the season as the bottom half of the Premiership. Despite Arsenal's impressive start, Wenger emphasized that Newcastle has many injuries, suggesting the reason behind their dismal standing is unknown. The match against Newcastle will be the Gunners' first away game of the season and if well-played, they will have a good advantage. With players coming back in training, Wenger maintains their squad can still contribute to the team's performance despite the absence of the injured players.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger expresses surprise at Newcastle's poor performance, which has dropped them to 14th in the Premiership after a difficult season. Despite their recent victory over Fulham on Sunday, Wenger believes injuries have contributed to the team's struggles, with fatigue not expected to be an issue as new players are returning.
qwen2.5:3b: Arsene Wenger admits he cannot explain why Newcastle are struggling in the bottom half of the Premiership table. The manager expresses surprise at Arsenal's upcoming match against Newcastle, who are currently 14th in the league due to injuries. Despite a recent win over Fulham, Wenger believes his team is well-prepared for the game. He also mentions that with players returning and sufficient squad depth, he can rotate more effectively. Striker Thierry Henry praises their performance against Fulham as "beautiful to watch", emphasizing the importance of playing as a cohesive unit rather than relying on individual brilliance.
opencoder:1.5b:
Wenger's shock at Newcastle dip 

Arsene Wenger has admitted he is at a loss to explain why Newcastle are languishing in the bottom half of the table. He said: "At the beginning of the season you would expect them to be fighting for the top four." The Gunners travel to St James' Park on Wednesday, with Newcastle 14th in the Premiership after a troubled season.

Wenger prepared for a game by winning the previous one, following Fulham's victory. Arsenal managed the game on the back of a 2-0 victory over Fulham on Sunday, adding to Wenger's enthusiasm: "The best way to prepare for a game is to win the previous one." Despite injury fatigue won't play too big a part in the next few weeks as we have players coming back. Striker Thierry Henry scored against Fulham and Henry described the display as "beautiful to watch."

He said his match was "the only thing that really matters" because it's about winning and scoring three points. Wenger appreciated this and said he would enjoy playing like he did against Fulham - playing a team and being part of a win, even when we could be there without the games.

In retrospect, Arsenal deserve a chance in the team. The experience helped them recover from injury fatigue and ready to face the upcoming season.
smollm:1.7b:
The summary of the text above should be:

Wenger shock at Newcastle dip after Arsenal travel to St James' Park on Wednesday, with Newcastle 14th in the Premiership after a troubled season. Wenger admitted he is at a loss to explain why they are languishing in the bottom half of the table. The Gunners travel to St James' Park on Wednesday, with Newcastle 14th in the Premiership after a 2-0 victory over Fulham on Sunday. And Wenger said: "At the beginning of the season you would expect them to be fighting for the top four. "I don't know how they got to be where they are. It looks to me from the outside that they have many injuries."

The summary should preserve key ideas and details, including:

* The main idea: Wenger shock at Newcastle dip after Arsenal travel to St James' Park on Wednesday, with Newcastle 14th in the Premiership after a troubled season.
* The supporting details:
	+ "At the beginning of the season you would expect them to be fighting for the top four." (Key idea)
	+ "I don't know how they got to be where they are." (Key idea)
	+ "The best way to prepare for a game is to win the previous one." (Key idea)
	+ "We will go to Newcastle in good shape." (Key idea)
	+ "Fatigue won't play too big a part in the next few weeks as we have players coming back so I can rotate a bit more. " (Key idea)
	+ "We do not play a season with 11 players and I believe that all of our squad deserve a chance in the team." (Key idea)
* The key ideas: Wenger shock at Newcastle dip, the main idea being that Wenger is at a loss to explain why they are languishing in the bottom half of the table.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, so I need to summarize this text about Wenger's shock at Newcastle losing in the Premiership. Let me read through it again carefully.

First, the main point is that Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is upset about why Newcastle isn't making the top four after a tough season. He admitted he can't explain it from the start because they weren't fighting for the top four initially. That makes sense because usually, teams in the Premiership might have higher expectations at the beginning of the season.

Next, he mentions that Newcastle has been struggling and is 14th in the league after a shaky season. They played well against Fulham on Sunday but still dropped out of the top four. I should note the specific numbers: 14th place after Sunday's victory and their losing streak.

He also talks about Arsenal going into Wednesday's game with a strong start over Fulham, scoring two goals. He says they expect to win their next match and that fatigue won't be a big issue in the near future because players are coming back and rotating more. That shows they're looking for consistency and not too much resting.

Thierry Henry scored against Fulham and described the performance as "beautifully played." He emphasized the importance of winning points, especially the three, which are crucial. He also touched on why they might lose some games but still enjoy the experience, mentioning past losses where they lost but still bounced back.

Putting it all together, I need to capture his disappointment, the current situation with Newcastle's standings and injuries, their recent form against Fulham, Henry's performance, and the overall strategy of preparing for future games by winning previous ones. I should make sure each of these points is included concisely without adding personal opinions or extra details.
</think>

Arsenine Wenger has admitted he cannot explain why Newcastle have fallen to 14th place in the Premiership after a shaky season. He noted that, from the start, they likely expected strong support for the top four positions. He pointed out their current standings and injuries despite their improving performance against Fulham.

Arsenal is aiming to win their next match, confident in their ability to rebuild their team. Henry described his performance as "beautifully played," emphasizing the significance of securing those 3 points. He highlighted that while some games may be frustrating due to losses, they are enjoyable when they reflect their experience and effort.
tinyllama:1.1b: Arsenal manager Arsène Wenger has admitted to being at a loss to explain why his side has struggled to secure wins in the Premier League. The club currently sits in the bottom half of the table, and Wenger suggested that injuries may be a contributing factor for their poor form. He also acknowledged the importance of winning games as well as playing as a team when Arsenal takes on Newcastle at St James' Park on Wednesday night. Wenger was noncommittal about his plans moving forward, saying "The best way to prepare for a game is to win the previous one," but added that he believes his squad is capable of performing better.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Acknowledging Arsenal's 2-0 victory over Fulham on Sunday, manager Arsene Wenger acknowledges Newcastle's troubling season. Meanwhile, the player Thierry Henry shares his delight at their performance against Fulham and describes it as "beautiful to watch." The Gunners travel to St James' Park on Wednesday, looking for a win to regain their position in the top four.
phi:2.7b: Arsene Wenger, the Arsenal manager, cannot explain why Newcastle are struggling in the Premiership. Newcastle has 14th place in the table after a rocky season. However, they won 2-0 against Fulham last Sunday and have a good chance of winning against Arsenal this week with their experienced squad. Their top scorer is Thierry Henry, who scored two goals against Fulham and said that he and his teammates play as a team to win games.
orca-mini:3b: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger admitted to bewilderment over Newcastle's current position in the Premier League table, with the Gunners traveling to St James' Park on Wednesday. The club is currently 14th, and Wenger cited injuries as a possible factor in their current state. However, he emphasized that all players deserve a chance in the team, and that winning is the only thing that truly matters. Arsenal won against Fulham earlier this month, with Thierry Henry describing the display as "beautiful to watch".
hermes3:3b: Arsene Wenger confused about Newcastle's poor performance in Premiership, expecting better from them but acknowledging their current 14th place position.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger expressed surprise at Newcastle's low positioning in the Premiership table, attributing their struggle to numerous injuries. Wenger emphasized the importance of winning matches and praised his squad's performance, highlighting a strong team mentality. Despite the challenges, he confidently believed that all players deserve a chance to play.
